00017 ## @namespace mainPanel
00018 #  Contains a class which helps positioning the widgets on the main application window
00019 #
00020 #  Allows creating notebooks in two positions if the a widget is positioned on top of 
00021 #  another
00022 
00023 from wx import Panel, GridBagSizer, Notebook, EXPAND, ALL
00024 
00025 class mainPanel(Panel):
00026     """A custom container, grouping all the widgets."""
00027     def __init__(self, master, size = (4, 4)):
00028         Panel.__init__(self, master)
00029 
00030         self.master = master
00031         self.sizer = GridBagSizer(*size)
00032         self.widgets = {} # holds the widgets as values. The keys are tuples with
00033                           # three members (row, col, colspan)
00034         self.sizer.AddGrowableCol(1)
00035         self.sizer.AddGrowableRow(1)
00036         
00037         self.SetSizerAndFit(self.sizer)
00038         
00039     def addtoPanel(self, widget, position):
00040         if (position == (1, 1, 1) or position == (2, 0, 2)) and position in self.widgets.keys():
00041             self.__addNotebook(position, widget)
00042         else:
00043             self.sizer.Add(widget, pos = (position[0], position[1]), span = (1, position[2]), flag = EXPAND|ALL)
00044             self.widgets[position] = widget 
00045 
00046     def __addNotebook(self, position, widget):
00047         """This function creates a notebook widget and replaces the self.widgets[position] with
00048         the notebook. If the notebook already exists then it is not replaced."""
00049         if isinstance(self.widgets[position], Notebook):
00050             self.widgets[position].AddPage(widget, widget.title)
00051         else:
00052             ntbk = Notebook(self, -1)
00053             ntbk.AddPage(self.widgets[position], self.widgets[position].title)
00054             ntbk.AddPage(widget, widget.title)
00055             self.widgets[position] = ntbk
00056
